page.title: 14Land Use - Two Bridges
page.content:
The land around Two Bridges is totally contained within the bounds of the Dartmoor National Park, and the ancient bounds of the Forest of Dartmoor. The rights of the commoners still exist but are rarely exercised, and include rights of turbury and grazing.
Some of the land has been enclosed in the past to provide rough grazing, the remaining land being open moorland, also used for grazing. Stock consists entirely of sheep, beef cattle and ponies.
A small area has been planted with coniferous trees but is not of sufficient size to be of any great commercial interest.
